content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can define the `FloatWithUnits` struct and its `show` method in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fu.value, " ", fu.unit)
end
```

In this code, `Float64` is used to store the `value` field and `String` is used to store the `unit`. The `Base.show` function is overridden for the `FloatWithUnits` structure, so that when an instance of this structure is printed, the `show` function will be called that we have defined. This function will print the `value` and `unit` fields of the instance, separated by a space.
